instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One USB-C port data wont work
threads.message:
Board had <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> damaged, looked burned on top in a couple spots. Laptop worked but it would shutdown sometimes and data did not work on ports according to client.

<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> pads 80 and 81 were burnt bad (<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_TOP_P</SIGNAL> - <SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_BOT_P</SIGNAL>), one of them had to be bridged up since it was gone, after fixing that <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> was replaced and those voltages came back, but now one of the ports (not the one were the work was done) data doesnt work but only one side, if I turn the USB device data works fine and on the other port data works fine. Charging works on all 4 sides of the ports.

Already replaced the 2 <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> but same thing as far as data on the lower port <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>

When the port fails <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> is 1.2V (the other port I am using to power the board) if I turn the USB device around <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> is correct at 5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One USB-C port data wont work
threads.message:
The USB-C redriver chip looks good?
Change it, just in case.
The problem appears only with USB 2, or also USB 3 device?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One USB-C port data wont work
threads.message:
Problem seems to only happen with USB 3 devices.

USB-C redriver? please advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One USB-C port data wont work
threads.message: The small PI3USBxxxx chip on the opposite side of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One USB-C port data wont work
threads.message: Thanks, that did it, BTY the boardview I have is probably for the 00875 board as that IC is not present there, is the correct 00840 boardview available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One USB-C port data wont work
